title: Climate change: Seven ways to spot businesses greenwashing
description: Firms often claim they are eco-friendly but how can you check they are as green as they make out?

title: Matt Moulding: The billionaire THG boss facing a reality check
description: Matt Moulding floated THG in a blaze of glory, but a year later the shine has dimmed for the entrepreneur.

title: The man who has lived as a hermit for 40 years
description: Ken Smith lives without electricity or running water in a hand-made log cabin on the banks of a remote loch.

title: The kite engineer striving to revolutionise DIY wind power
description: Engineer Rod Read has spent the past decade building homemade spinning kite turbines that can generate clean electricity.

title: Man rescued after 53 hours in cave 'in good spirits'
description: More than 250 volunteers helped rescue the man from one of the UK's longest cave systems.

title: Portraits of Australian indigenous women win Taylor Wessing photo prize
description: Australian photographer David Prichard's series wins the prestigious Taylor Wessing Prize.

title: Yorkshire investigating new racism allegation by former academy player
description: A former Yorkshire academy player says he was racially abused by a member of staff as a 16-year-old, in the latest allegation of racism against the club.

title: Forced adoption: 'I'll never get over being forced to give up my baby'
description: The BBC's Duncan Kennedy meets Joan Chambers, who was forced to give up her baby son.

title: My day at COP26: 'Being the local host is a really important job'
description: Kat Jones is creating a warm welcome in Glasgow for COP26 visitors - in her role as project manager for Stop Climate Chaos Scotland.

title: Sir Ian McKellen surprises young aspiring actor
description: Aspiring actor Millie got an "amazing" surprise when Sir Ian McKellen asked to hang out with her.

title: 'Meticulous and dedicated' - Newcastle boss Howe, by those who know him best
description: An intense coach with question marks over his recruitment record - BBC Sport assesses Eddie Howe's Newcastle credentials.

title: Venus Williams: 'It's important people continue to break barriers'
description: The tennis star tells 5 Live's Rick Edwards she hopes future generations don't have to focus "on the colour of their skin".

title: TikTok: Missing girl found after using viral call for help sign
description: The hand gesture asking for help led to the rescue of a missing teenager in the US.

title: Fast & Furious: Vin Diesel asks The Rock to return
description: In an Instagram post, Vin Diesel said The Rock has "a very important role to play".

title: 'I had to get out' - US festival survivors  describe crush
description: Festivalgoers caught up in the crush at Astroworld, which left eight people dead, recall their fear.

title: COP26: Can clubbers' dance moves create renewable energy?
description: One Glasgow nightclub is to trial technology which captures body heat from dancers.

title: Fireworks set off as truck catches fire in Matchams
description: The fire set off dozens of fireworks from a truck at an event in Matchams.

title: 'I wish I hadn't given £300k to a man I met online'
description: One woman tells BBC Asian Network her experience of being a victim of "romance fraud".

title: The Papers: 'Storm in a sleaze cup' and 'Brexit trade war'
description: The backlash over the Owen Paterson lobbying row and UK-EU tensions feature on the front pages.

title: COP26: UK pledges £290m to help poorer countries cope with climate change
description: As the COP26 summit enters its second week, government ministers gather in Glasgow for more talks.

title: Covid-19: US reopens border to UK travellers after almost two years
description: After nearly two years, the US lifts its travel ban to UK visitors who have had both Covid vaccine doses.

title: Astroworld: Victims named as police probe US festival crush
description: Family and friends pay tribute to those who died at Travis Scott's Astroworld festival in Houston.

title: Defence secretary to meet Army chiefs over culture concerns
description: The treatment of women in the military and other issues will be raised by the defence secretary.

title: Why Tanzanian Nobel laureate Abdulrazak Gurnah is hardly known back home
description: Few of Abdulrazak Gurnah's novels are sold in Tanzania where reading fiction is not popular.

title: US-Canada border: After 19 months, families to reunite
description: The land border will soon fully reopen to vaccinated travellers, allowing families to reconnect.

title: Wildlife photographer captures amazing shots on lunch break
description: Dave Newman captures impressive wildlife photos in Sleaford town centre in the middle of the day.

title: Hundred people die challenging terminally ill benefits awards
description: Around 100 people who were denied fast-tracked disability benefits died while challenging the decision.

title: Dug Dug: A film inspired by India's motorcycle god
description: A new film riding on the back of a temple in India dedicated to a motorcycle deity is making waves.

title: COP26: Fossil fuel industry has largest delegation at climate summit
description: There are more participants than from any single country, a study shared with the BBC suggests.

title: Owen Paterson: MPs to debate standards reform following row
description: The Lib Dems are calling for the system to be overhauled, amid claims of "sleaze" at Westminster.

title: How will the US deal with a shortage of 80,000 truckers?
description: The chronic lack of lorry drivers in the US is adding to supply chain woes - and could get worse.

title: TikTok videos humanise Colombia's cocaine workers
description: Social media videos in Colombia reveal how the people on the lowest rung of the cocaine industry work and live.

title: Diamonds v trees: The community trying to save its forest
description: The Madhya Pradesh state government says a new diamond mine will bring jobs but local people say their lives will be destroyed.

title: The space telescopes inspired by lobsters
description: By mimicking the way lobsters’ eyes work, scientists have designed new X-ray space telescopes that can survey much larger areas.

title: New York gears up for tourists' return as US lifts ban
description: As the travel ban is lifted hotels and restaurants face challenges in getting service back to normal.
